Class SignalView

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel

              • gst.ui.SignalView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataChangeListener, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.awt.print.Printable, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, org.jfree.chart.event.ChartChangeListener, org.jfree.chart.event.ChartProgressListener, org.jfree.chart.event.OverlayChangeListener

    public class SignalView
extends org.jfree.chart.ChartPanel
implements DataChangeListener
    The graph of a signal in a diagram. At this moment just a raw hull.
    Version:
    0.1.5.5 (18.10.2012)
    Author:
    Enrico Grunitz
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • centerTimeAxisOn

        public void centerTimeAxisOn(double centerPoint)
        Centers the diagram on the given (domain-axis-) location. Doesn't change the overall range of the domain-axis.
        Parameters:
        centerPoint - point in time to center on

      • shiftTimeAxisRelative

        public void shiftTimeAxisRelative(double value)
        Moves the view over the time axis by given percentage of displayed range. Positive values increase the bounds, negatives decrease the values.
        Example:
        time axis bounds are 40 .. 60; value = 50; new bounds -> (40 .. 60) + (60 - 40) * 50 / 100 = 50 .. 70
        Parameters:
        value - percentage value of displayed time axis range to shift view for-/backward

      • zoomTimeAxisRelative

        public void zoomTimeAxisRelative(double value)
        Shrinks or increases the range of the time axis by a relative value (percent point) of the displayed range. Positive values decreases and negative values increases the range ignoring values <= -100 and >= 100.
        Example:
        time axis bounds are 40 .. 60; value = 50; new bounds -> (40 .. 60) +- (60 - 40) * (50/2) / 100 = 45 .. 55
        Parameters:
        value - percentage value of displayed time axis range to zoom in/out

      • zoomTimeAxis

        public void zoomTimeAxis(double rangeValue)
        Sets the time-axis range to the given value but keeps the central value unchanged.
        Parameters:
        rangeValue - new range of the time-axis

      • setYAxisLabel

        public void setYAxisLabel(java.lang.String labelText)

        Parameters:
        labelText - the label String
